summary.para: Called by the Microsoft Media Foundation to open HTTP or HTTPS URLs instead of using the default implementation.

param.name: wszScheme
param.para: The name of the protocol to for which an is being requested. Microsoft Media Foundation specifies the protocol scheme of the URL that the application provided the Media Foundation Source Resolver. Valid values include “http” for HTTP, and “https” for HTTPS. URL scheme names are generally not case-sensitive.

param.name: ppDownloadSession
param.para: On successful execution, the parameter is set to a pointer to an interface. The returned interface is used by Microsoft Media Foundation to open a single HTTP or HTTPS URL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The value specified for the wszScheme parameter is incorrect.
The ppDownloadSession parameter is an invalid pointer.
There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.

remarks.para: Specifying “https” as the value of wszScheme does not imply that HTTPS will be used for a particular request, as that is specified on a per-request basis in .

summary.para: Applications implement this interface in order to provide custom a custom HTTP or HTTPS download implementation. Use the interface to register the provider. For more information, see Using the Source Resolver. Once registered, the Microsoft Media Foundation will invoke the method of the provider implementation to open HTTP or HTTPS URLs instead of using the default implementation.
